result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew B Schreiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge

--Complete Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Counseling
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No possession of dangerous weapons
--No acts/threats of violence

Arresting Agency:  WTPD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew B Schreiner
Current: N964 County Rd R, Watertown, WI 53098 United States  (Effective: 06-08-2015)
Prior: 1216 S. 102nd St., West Allis, WI 53214 United States

Case called at 1:35 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Matthew B Schreiner in court with Attorney Erik Brian Ellingson. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Schreiner submits plea paperwork & letter from treatment provider

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
Court finds that the facts of disoderly conduct include that the action involved his spouse & intentional impairment of physical condition & for the other person to reasonably fear imminent engagement a more physical act of battery and so find that the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable. 

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--Complete Certified Batterer's Treatment and Intervention Counseling
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--No possession of dangerous weapons
--No acts/threats of violence
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge

Days credit for time already served: 3 days
Court orders letter from treatment provider to be sealed & for the March treatment letter also be sealed
Recess: 1:52 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew B Schreiner
Current: 1216 S. 102nd St., West Allis, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 03-20-2015)
Prior: 408 Bradley St, Watertown, WI 53094
from non-party re: counseling, submitted at 3/20/15 STC

Case called at 2:44pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Matthew B Schreiner in court with Attorney Erik Brian Ellingson.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Ellingson indicates that resolution is near, and requests a Plea date 4 weeks out. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 

On Defense Motion to Modify Bail Conditions
--arguments by Counsel, Atty. Ellingson submits letter in support of Motion
--Statement made by Holly Schreiner 

The State submits a draft of settlement offer to the Court, upon questioning of the Court.
The Court presents basis and denies modification of bond.  
The Court directs Mr. Schreiner to notify his attorney of his address within 24 hours, and then for attorney to notify 

Court on its own Motion modifies bond to require a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Holly Schreiner
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at 408 Bradley St. Watertown
--No possession of any dangerous weapons 
recess: 3:08pm

NEXT: Plea/ Sent: May 15,2015 at 1:30
Status conference on March 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 10:40 am.

Case called at 1:37 pm [Clerk SH]
[Judge Randy R. Koschnick presiding for BrII]
Defendant Matthew B Schreiner appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Erik Brian Ellingson.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient 

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Holly Schreiner
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at 408 Bradley St. Watertown
X  EXCEPTION - The Defendant shall be allowed presence at the address above on one occasion to obtain personal belongings if it is done with supervision by a law enforcement officer.
Recess: 1:41 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/4/15 at 10:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 3/20/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
